Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2013 06:37PM HotPinkMess wrote: Kika you and I have very similar diagnoses. I had a lumpectomy April 25th then when I needed reexcision surgery decided to go ahead and do a double mastectomy with implants. Had my mastectomy Tuesday. Much more pain this time around plus drains are the disadvantages but I'm still glad I changed my mind. With lumpectomy you usually need radiation, which affects reconstruction choices a lot. Good luck!
Posts.Title: having real trouble w/ mastectomy vs. lumpectomy choice kika2013 slv58

Posts.Content: HotPinkMess wrote: Just had a lump checked yesterday, which did NOT show up in a mammogram 4 months ago.  3 months ago my obgyn said it was a cyst and to keep an eye on it.   Lo and Behold, went to Breast Dr yesterday, radiologist almost immediately upon looking at new mammogram and ultrasound said it was cancer.  When I questioned her she said she was 99.9 percent sure and then did a biopsy.  I'll get results Tuesday then schedule an MRI.  She said it's likely  stage one or two, about two centimeters, and she's not sure how bad it is.   I'm 50, have two small children, boys ages 6 and 8 and trying not to freak out.  She also said I should plan for both surgery and chemo very soon.  I'm going to a very highly regarded practice in Atlanta but still pretty scared.  Just wanted to introduce myself. Valeriehoff.com Dx 3/23/2013, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Surgery 6/17/2013 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 7/7/2013 Cryotherapy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 7/25/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 9/9/2013 Reconstruction (left): Latissimus dorsi flap; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap Surgery 12/16/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New and Nervous, trying not to freak out. HotPinkMess FilterLady

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2013 07:47PM HotPinkMess wrote: Thanks SOO much to all of you.  I have told this two friends, one is a Dr. and another who had a masectomy two years ago.   I'm actually grateful the radiologist was so direct; I could tell something was wonky with the sonogram technicians.  It was just totally unexpected.  I spent all day today organizing closets and drawers, do a lot of people do that?  I'm pretty resigned to a cancer diagnosis and now just hoping it hasn't spread.   My DH has been amazing about it so far and doesn't really care whether I have boobs and hair, so I feel really blessed as long as we can get rid of it.
Posts.Title: New and Nervous, trying not to freak out. HotPinkMess FilterLady

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2013 06:40PM HotPinkMess wrote: My sentinel node incision is leaking clear or yellowish fluid like crazy. I wake up in the morning with about a six inch wet spot on the sheet. Is this normal? I have very little pain and a slightly swollen armpit. Lumpectomy was 3 days ago. Other than that and some fatigue I feel fine.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Thursday! HotPinkMess HotPinkMess

Posts.Content: HotPinkMess wrote: Any and all advice for before, during and after would be much appreciated.  Having 2 centimeter tumor removed and Sentinel node biopsy.   I have not added all this to my signature but it is IDC with lobular features, HER2 neg (+1) estrogen and projesterone positive.   Surgeon does not think chemo is on the horizon but radiologist does so I think we'll all know more after surgery.   A TV crew will also be shooting parts of the procedure for a breast cancer story.  Might have to wear a teeny bit of makeup :) Valeriehoff.com Dx 3/23/2013, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Surgery 6/17/2013 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 7/7/2013 Cryotherapy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 7/25/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 9/9/2013 Reconstruction (left): Latissimus dorsi flap; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap Surgery 12/16/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2013 05:06PM HotPinkMess wrote: This is an awesome thread, I just learned so much!  I wish I'd known all the options for reconstruction with lumpectomy and rads compared to mastectomy.  I wish I'd seen a PS earlier.  Since I'm still right in the middle of it all, will probably have more Wish I'd Knowns later on.

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2013 09:53PM HotPinkMess wrote: Thanks,the lumpectomy went great, took two lymph nodes. She said 95 percent sure they are negative. I'm home feeling woozy but no pan. Follow up visit next week f
